text: Raymond Roy Rippelmeyer (July 9, 1933 â€“ September 9, 2022) was an American professional baseball player and pitching coach. He was a right-handed pitcher. He played for the Washington Senators in 1962. He coached for the Philadelphia Phillies from 1970 to 1978. Rippelmeyer died on September 9, 2022, at the age of 89. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2022 deaths Category:Texas Rangers players Category:Sportspeople from Illinois
title: Ray Rippelmeyer
